Body: TGG and AG Contract Signing  On November 21, 2018, as the leader of the world's online gaming and top of Japan's Pachinko gaming, Top Game Group (hereinafter referred to as "TGG") and Apollon Gaming Japan (hereinafter referred to as "AG") signed a comprehensive strategic cooperation agreement. Chairman of TGG Board of Directors Bingxin Xie, Director and CEO of Apollon Foundation Alan Lau, Director of Apollon Foundation and CEO of AG Company Kenji Nishihara, Director of Apollon Foundation Mika Katsube and Representative of TGG Company John, attended and witnessed the signing ceremony.   After the signing of the agreement, TGG and AG will build a high-liquidity digital currency payment and settlement application model based on the full-flow blockchain technology infrastructure and overall blockchain technology solutions provided by the Apollon Foundation. This will promote the online and offline full-scene applications of digital money in online games and related entertainment industries, providing more playable and attractive game products, creating a player community with excellent experience and building a new generation of blockchain entertainment and gaming platform.

Body: APO determines the block out time and in this case, every 0.5 seconds. At a given time, the production of each block will only be granted to a block producer. If a block fails to be produced within the specified time, the block at that specific time will be skipped. In the APO system, 126 blocks will be generated per round (each block producer produces 6 blocks, multiplied by 21 block producers). 21 independent block producers will be voted by APO holders. If a block producer misses a block in production or does not produce any block within 24 hours, they will be removed from the block producers until they announce their intention to re-produce blocks to the entire network again.
